content.description: Ascend the right side chossy incline section up to a clearing at the top. There are bolts with chains to anchor into. Solid cracks to place gear in once you finish the first scramble.Â
content.protection: Standard trad rack of cams and nuts will be useful. Bring a rope tarp to drape over the top if possible.
content.location: Just left of 240 Shorty (5.9)

content.description: Thin, long, overhanging moves past 3 bolts lead to a bulging roof boulder problem.  Crank over bulge to a no hands rest.  Continue over several more bolts on 5.10 terrain. Great rock quality.  Skirting left of the bulge lowers the grade.
content.protection: Bolts with permadraws. 2 bolt anchor with rings
content.location: Right of Aerial Sewer, Left of NC Sport Climbing

content.description:
The origins of this route may be lost to history; locals from the Yellow Bluff heyday of the 80s are unclear on who may have done the FA.  If more information becomes available, I'll update this entry. 

  A nice line on excellent orange rock, Unnamed #1 is straightforward face climbing with no distinct crux.  Follow the line of new bolts to the top.
content.location: Starts just left of Orange Crush.

content.description: Climb a hand crack to a large ledge at the base of an overhanging dihedral.  Climb dihedral past several bolts and permadraws.  Used to be a dicey gear line until the pitons ripped out.
content.location: Just right of Samson and Delilah.  Shares it's first bolt with Gossamer.

content.description: Climb the wide crack.  A few awkward moves here and there.
content.protection: Typical rack with extra wide stuff.
content.location: Obvious crack right of Nameless, left of Loaded.

content.description: Stick clip a fixed nut and boulder onto the wall.  Climb the tombstone feature on the right, in the dihedral or out left, on the arete.  Both protect well and are of similar difficulty.  From the top of the tombstone feature wander up a right past a horizontal slot and up to the anchor.
content.protection: Single run of cams, nuts. 2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Obvious tombstone shaped feature just left of Leaky Faucet.

content.description: Climb up jugs to a ledge.  Walk right to a left facing dihedral.  Climb dihedral to the roof.  Pull out right and climb up, past a bolt, to the anchor.
content.protection: Trad, 1 bolt. 2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Right of Reach around, just left of Faith.

content.description:
Tilt-a-Whirl is a route with some history, and a victim of a lack of documentation of that history. 

  Back in the 80s before Yellow Bluff was closed to climbers, Bernard Wolfe established Tilt-a-Whirl as a 5.11 trad route.  After the crag was closed and lay dormant for 20 years, knowledge of this and other routes faded from memory.  Flash forward to 2009 when the SCC succeeded in re-opening Yellow Bluff; on the grand opening day, few if any of the original route developers were around to share their knowledge.  As a result, Tilt-a-Whirl was unknowingly retro-bolted and re-named Little Angry Jamie.  More recently, its history has come to light and the final disposition of the route and its retro-bolts has yet to be determined.
content.protection: Eight bolts (subject to change), bolted anchors.
content.location: Starts left of Samson and Delilah. Look for a black band of rock just left of the route.

content.description: Second bolt protects a roofy crux, and then onto easy but slightly run out past a few bolts to the top.
content.protection: Can't remember. Let me know so I can update. There are anchors.
content.location: To the left of Mr. Todd's Wild Ride.

content.description: Scramble to a ledge.  A couple easy moves lead to a crimpy crux.  Fight the pump to the anchors.
content.location: Right of Old School, left of Prince Albert.

content.description: Face climb three bolts and anchor.
content.location: Left of 240 Shorty and last route on wall before trail ends and you have to drop down and around broken rock.

content.description: Same start as Step Up.  At the second bolt, move out right through the roof.  Face climbing leads up to another difficult boulder problem guarding the anchor.  A little harder than step up.
content.location: Same start as Step Up

content.description: Thin, crimpy boulder problem up to the roof.  Easier but pumpy climbing through the roof and the face above leads to another roof.  Surmount the final roof to find the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts, permadraw on the second bolt.  2 both anchor with chains.
content.location: Right of Hollowman, left of Cargoblasting.

content.description:
Crimp up the brittle face to the base of the roof.  A steep thin move to an undercling and a tricky clip guards the dihedral leading to the anchor. 

  An extension out the crack and up the main headwall awaits a first ascent.  This route stays dry in the rain.
content.protection: 3 or 4 bolts and anchors with carabiners.
content.location: Under the large roof near the property boundary.

content.description: the crux is definitely the start on incut terrain.getting your feet on is tricky,after that tread up beautiful holds and easy terrain to a wide ledge.rap off or continue right along ledge for pitch two
content.location: just to the right of dirty love

content.description: Ascend the left side incline with jugs and chickenheads. Easy scrambling with the occasional sloper.Â
content.protection: Standard rack with a tarp to drape to prevent rope from scraping against the edge.
content.location: Left scramble of the face that's right next to 240 Shorty.Â

content.description:
Scramble up to a ledge.  From the left end of the ledge follow 4 bolts up over then holds and a few fun moves to the anchor. 

  This route stays dry in the rain.
content.location: Right of the waterfall, left of Arlan's Route.

content.description: Grab a crimp and a sidepull at the ground. Power up and right to a block.  Move up to some solid crimps and get some gear in the horizontal. Climb up easier ground and sling 2 horns.  Clip the fixed nut in the horizontal and finish up the top of Cardio.
content.location: Right of Double Tap, Left of That Thing You Do.

content.description: Boulder up to big ledge. Stick-clip first hanger,    and from crack start out on small edges, (this is the crux) To get into the roof, make an iron cross move to a slot to gain access to large incut. From here work the incut through two draws to the face. From here it's one long reach to small crimp for access to face, continue up face to easier ground to the top.
content.location: Look for high roof two with purple draws on the roof.

content.description: Face climbing to a 2' roof with marginal rock quality.  Keep an eye out for gear along the way.  Pull the roof, pass a few horns, and clip the anchors.
content.location: Right of Diamond Maker, left of Todd's Corner.

content.description: Climb the ledge to get to the only bolt and continue up the chicken heads. The rap rings are slightly to the left and of the first bolt
content.protection: 1 bolt, 2 60cm slings, and 2 rap anchors at top
content.location: Start about 15 ft left of Dirty love

content.description: This popular route stays mostly to the left of the water groove, with anchors up and to the right of the groove.
content.location: To the right of Lucifer's Revenge

content.description:
Some have said this should get an R rating, but if you trust in some shallow nuts in the lower half I would say PG.  The physical crux is protected by 2 bomber pins, the topmost of which recently held a nice whipper.  Pull onto the undercut wall and trend just slightly left to a #3 cam placement about 10-15 feet up.  Continue up fantastic, steep, technical face moves through 2 pitons and the ultimate crux.  Pull this and continue through a small amount of 5.7 to a bolted anchor. 

  Stellar face climbing on beautiful rock.
content.protection: Small rack, but a #3 is nice down low, and some nuts are useful on the first half. Ends at bolted anchors.
content.location: Nice yellow/orange wall, look for purple sling on a fixed pin mid-way up, near a second pin.

content.description: Scramble to a ledge.  Some tricky face climbing gains a left facing blocky corner.  Climb corner to the anchor.  Beware of loose rock.
content.protection: You can clip the first bolt of Arlan's route if you like.  Otherwise, typical rack.  2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Right of Arlan's Route, left of Teeth.

content.description: Massive link up of 3 routes with a V6 boulder problem in the middle.  Not a hard crux for a 13, but the pump will get you.  Climb the first three bolts of Tilt-A-Whirl (called Little Angry Jamie on MP) then head right to the Samson and Delilah jug rail.  Traverse across the jug rail until you clip the last chain draw in the roof.  Figure out a way to pull the roof lip and get over to where Gossamer breaks from Tradmaster.  Finish on Gossamer.
content.location: Starts on Tilt-A-Whirl, finishes on Gossamer.

content.description: Same start as Mountaineer's Route but continue to top instead of moving right on ledge.
content.location: Same start as Mountaineer's Route, just right of the gully where the trail meets the wall.

content.description: Bouldery start that meanders up the wall. Solid holds with good rests.
content.location: Left of Black Hole.

content.description: Bouldery moves off the ground give way to juggy dihedral.  This leads to a ledge and moderate terrain.
content.protection: Bolts and a piton.  2 bolt anchor carabiners.
content.location: Right of Vulgar and Rude.

content.description: 5 bolts.  A painful hold at the base of the roof marks the start of the crux.
content.location: 50' right of Mountaineer's route, left of TP Crack.

content.description: Easy moves get you into an alcove and then the fun begins. Use sloppers, finger crack, and hidden holds to get up to the crimp above. Apparently this also goes on gear to spice it up.
content.location: To the left of The 10.

content.description:
P1:  Start up either Todd's Corner (5.8) or Faith (5.10) and traverse right along the ledge about 20' off the ground, past a piton, to a 2 bolt belay. 

  P2: Climb up and right over bolts.
content.location: Right of MP1, left of the Abandoned Project.

content.description:
P1:  Start up either Todd's Corner (5.8) or Faith (5.10) and traverse right along the ledge about 20' off the ground, past a piton, to a 2 bolt belay. 

  P2:  Climb up and left off the belay over bolts.
content.location: Right of Faith, Left of MP2.

content.description:
P1: Difficult start.  Pull onto the wall then continue up easy blocky ground to a ledge with a bolt and a piton. 

  P2:  Walk right until ledge ends.  Continue traversing right, past a pine tree to gain another ledge with a 2 bolt anchor. 

  Be cautious rappelling from here as you are above other routes.
content.location: Right of the gully where the main trail meets the wall.

content.description: Climb a wide crack to a ledge.  Pull crimps up a thin seam (small nuts) then break left to a dihedral.  This route sports some holds of questionable rock quality.
content.protection: Typical rack plus some thin stuff.
content.location: Right of Gossamer, left of Green Eggs and Ham

content.description: Interesting off the deck - to a fun jug hall. Great warm-up route.
content.location: Route just to the right of Orange Crush (11 - Trad)

content.description: Start on pedestal.  Move up and right under a roof to an overhanging shield feature.  Overhung thin moves lead to the anchor.
content.location: Just right of TP crack, left of Injection Burn.

content.description: Start on an undercling in a dihedral.  Excellent 5.10 face climbing past several bolts to a permadraw.  Crank way up on thin holds to a deep 2 finger pocket that is often wet.  Keep it together past a couple more moves to gain a stance.  Easier ground leads to the anchor.  Probably the tallest route at YB.
content.location: Right of The Tombstone, Left of Double Tap.

content.description: real fun trad route on positive rock.this route was retro bolted for reasons unsure and not by myself
content.location: From where the trail meets the cliff, turn right and continue down the bluff to the end.  Last of a Long Line is the last route on the wall.

content.description:
Start to the left of the first bolt and pull your way up to a ledge where you can reach across to the left to clip the second bolt. From the ledge, trend back left and up on positive hold to the anchor.  

  The crux is in between the third and fourth bolt as you traverse left on positive edges with poor feet.
content.location: Left of Noob, right of Loaded on the left side of the Oompaloompa Wall (first wall seen past the tower on your right  from approach trail)

content.description: Stick clip a bolt and pull onto the wall.  Climb over the sketchy hollow flake to the base of the roof and another bolt.  Pull out the roof out right and place some gear at the lip from a poor stance (crux).  Easier climbing to the top.
content.protection: 2 bolts, typical rack.  2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Right of Cultural Diversity, left of Step Up.

content.description: Face climb to a standing ledge at anchors.
content.location: First climb to left of Butter Chubs.

content.description: Easy climbing leads to a chain and a slopey boulder problem.
content.location: Right of Lucky 13.  Left of the waterfall.

content.description:
Starts just right of Samson and Delilah (12+) and Tradmaster (dihedral, 11). Tradmaster and Gossamer share the first perma.  

  Boulder up the corner of the ledge just to the right of the roof with the 5 perma-draws (2 of them will be yellow webbing as of this post). Once you boulder up to the start, move to the dihedral with the first low hanging perma. If you like your belayer, place a #3 C4 in the crack just below the first perma to anchor them in. 

  From here climb up the dihedral but trend right to the next perma (yellow webbing). Continue trending right through the perma-draws. At the 5th perma, you will go up, out of the roof, and slightly left to a single bolt. Continue climbing above this to a two bolt anchor. 

NOTE: The DCA puts this route as Ardian's Route.
content.protection:
5 perma-draws on route, single bolt once you pull the roof at the 5th perma, to a single bolt anchor.  

  Bring 2 draws and something to anchor your belayer (#3 C4) 

  Yellow webbing perma-draws are good as of this post; as well as, the other perma-draws and biners.
content.location: Ledge just to the right of Samson and Delilah (12+) / Tradmaster (11). Tradmaster and Gossamer share the first perma in the dihedral

content.description: Abandoned project.  A hard boulder problem through a roof.
content.location: Right of MP2, left of Cultural Diversity.

content.description:
Climb Samson and Delilah to the first chain draw.  Rest on the jug rail then pull the roof lip (Novacaine crux) and continue straight up some  thin, hard face moves and finish on Tradmaster.   

  Note: Traversing right to the big Tradmaster undercling instead of going straight up the face drops the grade to 12d/13a.
content.location: Same start as Tradmaster, Samson and Delilah, and Gossamer, right after the waterfall.

content.description: Starts just to the right of a big tree. Bouldery start up to a big pocket - then trend right up to a ledge. From the ledge it is some fun crusier climbing up to the anchors.
content.protection: 7 bolts to anchors at the top. Might want to bring a cordelette to extend the anchors if you have top-ropers in your group. If I remember correctly, the anchors are back up on a ledge at the top.
content.location: 100 ft before Orange Crush

content.description: Fun climbing when it's dry.  A powerful start leads to moderate face climbing and a bulgy crux.
content.location: In the perpetually wet area right of NC Sport Climbing and left of The Tombstone.

content.description: Face climb to a right facing flake.  Layback to the base of the roof.  Reach out and make a clip, a runner helps here.  Pull the roof on big holds.  Fun face climbing to the anchors.  Sustained but never too hard.
content.protection: Bolts. 2 bolt anchor with permadraws.  Stick clip recommended
content.location: Right of Leaky Faucet, left of That Thing You Do.

content.description:
The origins and name of this nice trad line are unknown; Curt and Betty Jo Merchant said it was used back in the day as a warm-up for harder climbs.  The current name is a reference to the lichen and dirt that's gathered on the route after years of disuse, but with more traffic, it should clean up quite nicely. 

  Starting just left of a gully, climb the face with good protection on mostly juggy holds past an overhang or two to anchors at the top.
content.protection: Mostly small to medium gear; nuts and tricams are useful.  Newly-installed ring anchors at the top.
content.location: Starts near the end of the trail up from the parking lot, just left of a prominent steep gully/chimney.  Rap from the anchors.

content.description: Easy face climbing on thin gear up to a bolt.  Clip it and pull through the left edge of a 2' roof.  Easy ground to anchors.
content.protection:
Thin gear, 1 bolt. Anchors with rings.

 Edit: now a fully bolted sport route.Â
content.location: Right of Outstanding, left of Reach Around.

content.description: Almost always wet but amazing if you can get on it.  Powerful crimpy moves down low to a horizontal and a stance at the base of a roof.  Power over the roof on sloping rails and up into a Horse Pens style boulder problem.  Once you've "topped it out" continue on easier wandering climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts, a few permadraws.  2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Right of the abandoned project and left of Hollowman.

content.description: Dihedral on left of hallway. Dirty broken corner starting with a slight overhang on left or a slabby face start on the right.
content.location: Route directly to right of Butterchubs in hallway between main wall and tower with two bolt anchor at top.

climbs.name: Cloudy With A Chance Of Rockfall

content.description: The primary crux is between the 3rd and 4th bolt where the route gets a little "blank." The first section of 'Cloudy' is a typical Yellow Bluff start, matching on the first hold to get high feet and a couple power moves to a small shelf before the second bolt. The last section requires pulling a roof to get to the anchors. The route is more sustained and technical than other 5.10s at YB where two or three moves through a steep section lead to 5.6 or 5.7 climbing to finish the last 60 percent of the route â looking at you 'That Thing You Do' and the other uninspiring route that should remain 'Nameless.'
content.protection: Bolts and anchors at the top.
content.location: The route is between 'Noob' and 'Injection Burn.'Â

content.description: Climb up the first 2 bolts of Tilt-a-whirl but the move out left to another line of bolts.
content.location: Same start as Tilt-a-whirl.  Right of Step Up Right, left of Samson and Delilah.

content.description: Same start as Double Tap.  Climb past the first 2 bolts to a right facing flake.  Climb flake out right to a horizontal with a fixed nut.  Finish at anchor for That Thing You Do.
content.location: Same start at Double Tap.

content.description: First bolted climb up the trail on arÃªte. Face climb to an awkward off width at the top.
content.location: First climb on an arÃªte as the trail meets the rock.

content.description: Face climb on a rounded wall with a surprise giving the route its name(I'm guessing).
content.location: First route around broken section of cliff.

content.description:
Scramble up to a ledge.  Climb up and left through juggy overhung terrain.  Move back right to find the anchors. 

  This route stays dry in the rain.
content.location: Right of Sex Noises, left of Old School.

content.description: Stick clip the first bolt.  Power onto the wall and traverse right, past another bolt, under a large roof.  Pull through the roof and continue through a wave-like feature.  Moderate climbing over beautiful orange rock leads to the anchor.
content.location: Through the rightmost edge of the large roof at the property boundary.  Right of Steam Room Board Meeting, Left of Vulgar and Rude.

content.description: Face climb with crux move in the middle.
content.protection: Sport route with four bolts and anchors/
content.location: Left of Head in the Toilet

content.description: The right side of the Yellow Bluff cliff continues left from the approach trail about 1,500' to the SCC property line.  This property line is marked with a "no trespassing" sign; do not hike or climb past this sign or you'll be jeopardizing future access by trespassing!
